melee:
ranseur +3 (2d4+1/×3), bite -2 (1d6 plus sinful bite) or

bite +3 (1d6+1 plus sinful bite), 2 claws +3 (1d4+1)
description: This hairless humanoid lurches on back-bent, dog-like legs, its hideous mouth flanked by tiny arms with three-fingered hands.

sections.body: Sinspawn are proficient in all simple and martial weapons, armor, and shields (except tower shields).
sections.name: Martial Proficiency

sections.body: Sinspawn have scent against creatures whose nature reflects the sinspawn's sin. For example, wrathful sinspawn can scent creatures using rage effects. The GM should adjudicate what creatures a particular sinspawn can scent.
sections.name: Sin-Scent

sections.body: A creature bitten by a sinspawn is overwhelmed with sinful thoughts (DC 12 Will save negates). These emotions are so powerful that the target becomes sickened for 1d6 minutes. An affected target that is bitten a second time is staggered for 1 round if it fails its saving throw. Calm emotions, remove curse, or break enchantment negates the effects of sinful bite. The save DC is Charisma-based. This is a mind-affecting effect.
sections.name: Sinful Bite

sections.body: Sinspawn are corrupted products of magic used by spellcasters in a past era as shock troops for their armies. Literally the embodiment of a sin made flesh, they are sentient abominations of distilled ectoplasm imprinted with the soul-image of slain creatures that possessed an abundance of a particular sin.
The above stats represent a wrathspawn, the most common type of this creature. Each type possesses unique ability modifiers, which are listed after their name.
sections.name: Seven Types of Sinspawn

sections.body: Short and thin, envyspawn often become rangers.
sections.url: pfsrd://Bestiary 2/Monsters/Sinspawn/Seven Types of Sinspawn/Envyspawn (+2 Str/-2 Cha)
sections.name: Envyspawn (+2 Str, -2 Cha)

sections.body: Obese yet hardy and strong, gluttonspawn often become fighters.
sections.url: pfsrd://Bestiary 2/Monsters/Sinspawn/Seven Types of Sinspawn/Gluttonspawn (+2 Con/-2 Dex)
sections.name: Gluttonspawn (+2 Con, -2 Dex)

sections.body: Towering over 7 feet in height, greedspawn have gold-tinged veins and often become rogues.
sections.url: pfsrd://Bestiary 2/Monsters/Sinspawn/Seven Types of Sinspawn/Greedspawn (+2 Dex/-2 Wis)
sections.name: Greedspawn (+2 Dex, -2 Wis)

sections.body: With perfectly formed bodies sitting in grotesque counterpoint to their monstrous faces and claws, lustspawn often become sorcerers.
sections.url: pfsrd://Bestiary 2/Monsters/Sinspawn/Seven Types of Sinspawn/Lustspawn (+4 Cha/-2 Con/-2 Wis)
sections.name: Lustspawn (+4 Cha, -2 Con, -2 Wis)

sections.body: Unique among sinspawn for their long manes of hair, pridespawn are near-skeletal in their gauntness. They often become wizards.
sections.url: pfsrd://Bestiary 2/Monsters/Sinspawn/Seven Types of Sinspawn/Pridespawn (+4 Int/-2 Wis/-2 Cha)
sections.name: Pridespawn (+4 Int, -2 Wis, -2 Cha)

sections.body: Thick rolls of excess skin drape a slothspawn's hunched frame. They often become clerics.
sections.url: pfsrd://Bestiary 2/Monsters/Sinspawn/Seven Types of Sinspawn/Slothspawn (+2 Wis/-2 Dex)
sections.name: Slothspawn (+2 Wis, -2 Dex)

sections.body: These sinspawn use the statistics given above. They often become barbarians.
sections.name: Wrathspawn
